page.title: 04THE LOWER WYE VALLEY WALK
page.content: Our school went on the Lower Wye Valley Walk on the 16th May with the Warden Mr.Philip Page.We set off from Brockweir bridge and walked up through the woodlands towards Botany Bay.We stopped to look at Brockweir from a field which has been left to revert to natural woodland. We followed the way marked path(kept clear by the Wardens)through the Fore- stry Commission plantations of both deciduous and coniferous trees.We saw many different wild flowers and heard several Wood Warblers.We went near the Gwent Scout camp at Botany Bay and then through the woodlands and on into the Whitestone Trail. We then followed the yellow arrow and spot signs to Cleddon Falls and took the zigzag path down to Llandogo. We took three hours to complete our journey.
